result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven Vincent O'Leary was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 years probation; conditions of probation; 12 months county jail with huber to include employment and treatment, beginning 05-11-2015 immediately - 6 months STAYED if defendant successfully completes the STOP program; AODA treatment & follow-thru; victim impact panel; DNA surcharge; fine/costs/surcharges $2500.  Blood Draw Money to Sheriff - 23.45.  Forward $1,000 bond to DOC.
Driver's license revoked for 36 months plus 6 months;   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
IID 36 months effective 08-28-2015 on any vehicle owned or operated

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven Vincent O'Leary in court with attorney Susan Elizabeth Aasen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant previously plead NC to Ct. 1 but court held open; Court convicts on Ct. 1; Ct. 2 is dismissed but read-in.  Sentencing:  Withheld - 3 years probation; conditions of probation; 12 months county jail with huber to include employment and treatment, beginning 05-11-2015 immediately - 6 months STAYED if defendant successfully completes the STOP program; driver's license revoked for 36 months plus 6 months; IID 36 months 08-28-2015; AODA treatment & follow-thru; victim impact panel; DNA surcharge; fine/costs/surcharges $2500.  Blood Draw Money to Sheriff - 23.45.  Forward $1,000 bond to DOC.  Advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Steven Vincent O'Leary in court with attorney Susan Elizabeth Aasen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. DEF pleads NC to count 1,   court accepts plea, but holds open,  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm. Back On Record later, Atty Aasen requests different date. Rescheduled for 5/11/15.

Defendant Steven Vincent O'Leary in court with attorney Susan Elizabeth Aasen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, court is not satisfied that DEF has done STOP as stated on the record, need to adjourn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Steven Vincent O'Leary in court with attorney Susan Elizabeth Aasen.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF pleas not guilty  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Vincent O'Leary in court with attorney Susan E. Aasen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  waive right to preliminary, move to ARGN  Arraignment scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Steven Vincent O'Leary in court with Attorney Susan E. Aasen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

DE appears  in court, in custody by video.  John Yackel appears for the State.
Court finds probable cause.  Court orders $1000 cash bond with Special conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for Nov 4, 2014 @ 8:30 am.

SPECIAL BAIL BOND CONDITIONS
	FOR OPERATING WHILE INTOXICATED
	
	1.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages.
	2.  Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3.  Defendant shall be subject to random testing of his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing.  Failure to report to the STOP program may result in the issuance of a warrant for the defendants arrest, modification of bail, possible bail jumping charges, and/or forfeiture of bail.
